summary: The 'Troops Before Politicians Act' mandates that if members of the Armed Forces do not receive their pay on time, due to a lapse in appropriations or other reasons, the salaries of Members of Congress will be withheld and placed in an escrow account. These funds will be released to the Members of Congress once the issue is resolved or at the end of the 119th Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is tasked with assisting the payroll administrators of Congress in carrying out the Act.
